Comments_List: Every aspect of cloud data centers.
I learned a lot about systems and networking.

It encourages us to read essays.
But the coding homework is too little.

The lack of homework was probably the most evident weakness. It is hard when you don't have someone to grade it though, so I understand. The lectures were very rich with content, and we definitely got an intuition about many things. I liked that Dr. Yang helped though of us who did not have a strong networks background to learn from the ground up. It could probably be improved by adding a stronger framework for the class so that it was very clear what we were talking about, and how various parts fit together. Sometimes I was not sure how what we were learning fit into the larger picture.
Professor is helpful, course is hard but learn a lot
If you have a huge interest towards network, you can choose it. Or it might be a little challenging.
I would say that it depends on what you are looking to get out of it. If you are looking to learn some about networking and read some important papers in the field, then yes.
